intro: Rinorea pubipes, commonly known as the hairy rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Rinorea pubipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
